title: FPGAs communicating over Bluetooth Demo. Send/receive ASCII data, make a transparent UART

media:group.media:title: FPGAs communicating over Bluetooth Demo. Send/receive ASCII data, make a transparent UART
media:group.media:description:
Shows a demonstration of two Nandland Go Boards communicating to each other without wires over a Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) interface. This is a simple project that creates a "Transparent UART" between two devices, so that data that is received on one UART is forwarded to the remotely connected device.

Source code: https://github.com/nandland/bluetooth-rn4871-demo

Support me on Patreon: https://patreon.com/nandland

Get a Go Board for yourself: https://nandland.com/goboard/introduction.html

The Digilent PMOD Board: https://store.digilentinc.com/pmod-ble-bluetooth-low-energy-interface/
